document_data.name: Temple of Helm
document_data.mainbody: The '''Temple of Helm''' of [[Nashkel]] was a small holy house dedicated to the veneration of [[Helm|the Watcher]]. It was overseen by the [[cleric]] [[Nalin]] around [[1368 DR]].
document_data.Description: The temple's architecture was noticeably different than the surrounding buildings of Nashkel. A small cemetery was built around its facade, with more than a dozen headstones erected within it. Among the people buried within the graveyard was [[Daer'Ragh]], a [[mage]] who faked his own death.
